org.jemmy.fx

Class NodeWrap<T extends javafx.scene.Node>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jemmy.control.Wrap<T>
      • org.jemmy.fx.NodeWrap<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jemmy.control.ScreenArea, org.jemmy.interfaces.ControlInterface, org.jemmy.interfaces.Focusable, org.jemmy.interfaces.KeyTarget, org.jemmy.interfaces.MouseTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ControlWrap, ListViewWrap, MenuBarWrap, TableCellWrap, TableViewWrap, TabPaneWrap, TextWrap, ToolBarWrap, WebViewWrap

    @ControlType(value=javafx.scene.Node.class)
@MethodProperties(value={"getBaselineOffset","getBoundsInLocal","getBoundsInParent","getCacheHint","getClip","getContentBias","getCursor","getEffect","getId","getLayoutBounds","getLayoutX","getLayoutY","getOpacity","getParent","getProperties","getRotate","getRotationAxis","getScaleX","getScaleY","getScaleZ","getStyle","getStyleClass","getTransforms","getTranslateX","getTranslateY","getTranslateZ","getUserData","hasProperties","isCache","isDisable","isDisabled","isFocused","isHover","isManaged","isMouseTransparent","isPickOnBounds","isPressed","isResizable","isVisible"})
@ControlInterfaces(value={org.jemmy.interfaces.Parent.class,org.jemmy.interfaces.Showable.class},
                   encapsulates=javafx.scene.Node.class)
@DockInfo(generateSubtypeLookups=true)
public class NodeWrap<T extends javafx.scene.Node>
extends org.jemmy.control.Wrap<T>
implements org.jemmy.interfaces.Focusable
    Test support for JavaFX node. For simplicity, there is no special wrap class around Parent - any node could be treated as a parent for other nodes. If a node is not a Parent the hierarchy will be considered empty.
    Check lookup samples and input samples to get a feeling of what could be done with on this generic level.
    All properties common to all nodes are defined on this level.
    Author:
    shura, mrkam
    See Also:
    NodeDock
